text: Naha is an isolated village in the Mexican state of Chiapas, and its forest area is a federally recognized flora and fauna protection area. Naha's Mayan indigenous people are some of the few remaining speakers of the endangered Lacandon language. ==Sources== * The Endangered Lacandon Language, University of Victoria * Mexico's CONANP list of Protected Flora & Fauna Areas (Spanish) Category:Populated places in Chiapas Category:Protected areas of Chiapas Category:Flora and fauna protection areas of Mexico
title: Naha, Chiapas
